attributes.action: Ensure revenue from motorists is properly spent on roads and not used for other purposes
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is widely accepted that the UK's roads are in a deplorable condition yet British motorists continue to be squeezed until their pips squeak, this situation must not be allowed to continue! Motorists contribute around £70 billion to the chancellor's funds through duty on fuel, the road-fund licence and of course VAT on new cars, yet only a minute amount of this is invested in the UK's crumbling road infrastructure. I believe the government should commit to using this revenue to embark on a full maintenance programme to bring the  UK roads up to a standard equivalent to our European partners and not those of a third world country. Only once this is done should any surplus funds be used for other non-motoring related purposes.
